organizations: Nike Tournament of Champions Parkland High School

thread.title: Parkland girls volleyball has excellent national showing at Nike Tournament of Champions
thread.title_full: Parkland girls volleyball has excellent national showing at Nike Tournament of Champions

title: Parkland girls volleyball has excellent national showing at Nike Tournament of Champions
text:
Parkland High School's girls volleyball team placed fourth in the Nike Tournament of Champions. (lehighvalleylive.com file photo) By Kyle Craig | For lehighvalleylive.com on October 04, 2015 11:23 AM 
Parkland High School’s girls volleyball team has displayed it’s at the top of the game in Pennsylvania. 
But the Trojans were eager to find out where they stacked up on a bigger stage, particularly against teams from out West. They got their opportunity over the weekend at the Nike Tournament of Champions in Arizona. 
“They want to represent Pennsylvania,” Parkland coach Mike Krause said before the start of the regular season. “They feel a little Pennsylvania pride here. They feel they can play with them.” 
The results are in: On this side of the country or the opposite, the Trojans are a force to be reckoned with. 
Parkland, the defending PIAA Class AAA champion, placed fourth in the top (Platinum) tier of the event at the Kroc Center in Phoenix. 
The Trojans were undefeated in pool play Friday, knocking off Flagstaff (Ariz.), Gilbert (Ariz.) and St. John’s Lutheran (the defending Class AA Florida champion). 
Saturday, Parkland defeated East Lake (Calif.) and Emerald Ridge, the 2014 Class AAAA Washington runner-up, to book a spot in the semifinals. 
P.K. Yonge, the No. 2 team in the nation according to MaxPreps and reigning Class AAAA Florida champion, topped the Trojans 25-20, 26-24 in the semis. 
Defending Division I Arizona champion Desert Vista edged Parkland 21-25, 26-24, 15-11 in the third-place game. 
2014 Oregon 6A winner Jesuit topped P.K. Yonge in the championship. 
Here’s a breakdown of the Trojans’ fruitful trip: 
Parkland def. Flagstaff (Ariz.) 25-3, 20-25, 15-5 : Erika Foose 9 kills; Siena Salvaggio 9 kills; Kristin Krause 5 aces, 22 assists. 
Parkland def. Gilbert (Ariz.) 25-23, 25-20 : Siena Salvaggio 8 kills; Kristin Krause 22 assists. 
Parkland def. St. John’s Lutheran (Fla.) 25-21, 26-24 : Siena Salvaggio 8 kills; Sam Graver 7 kills; Avery Perosa 11 digs. 
Parkland def. East Lake (Calif,) 26-24, 25-15 
Parkland def. Emerald Ridge (Wash.) 25-23, 25-17 
P.K. Yonge (Fla.) def. Parkland 25-20, 26-24 
Desert Vista (Ariz.) def. Parkland 21-25, 26-24, 15-11
